messages.description: Usage message for the program. {0} is the program name.
Label for a Note - extra information associated with a message
Label for an Info message - informational message which is not a warning/error
Label for a Warning - code issue which isn't an error but can produce a 'code-smell'.
Label for an Error - error in the code, but compilation can attempt to continue.
Label for a fatal error - an error in the code which stops compilation immediately.
Label for an internal compiler error - error in the compiler itself.
Name to give the file that represents the command line.
Name to give the file that represents the standard input
Too many errors have occured, stopping compilation. {0} is the number of errors.
messages.C: Too many errors (have seen {0} error reports).

messages.description: Error whilst trying to read from a file, {0} is the file, {1} is the error message
Missing new line at end of non-empty file. (C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2)
messages.C: Missing new line at end of non-empty file (C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2).

messages.description: We have a splice ('\' followed by newline) immediately followed by end of file.  This is not permitted by C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2.
messages.C: '\' followed by newline, may not be the last characters in a file (C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2).

messages.description: We have a malformed UTF-8 character, shouldn't start with 0x80.
messages.C: Malformed UTF-8 character.  Shouldn't start with top-two bits set to 0x80.

messages.description: We have a malformed UTF-8 character, ran out of continuation characters too early.
messages.C: Malformed UTF-8 character.  Not enough continuation characters before next character start.

messages.description: We have a malformed UTF-8 character, ran out of continuation characters before the end of the line.
messages.C: Malformed UTF-8 character.  Not enough continuation characters before the end of the line.
